What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained a greater knowledge of Italian opera and culture through this course. Coming in, I did not know much about Italian Opera, but I was really happy to find the course very engaging.
Learned so much about Italian Opera through readings, films, and actual operas. We also reviewed important grammatical concepts, and covered a lot of vocab.

I learned a lot of interesting information about Italian operas, their composers, and the history of opera in general. I also developed my language skills, both written and verbal, in a relaxed, encouraging environment. I think this class gave awesome insight into such a great part of Italian culture, and it connected real world themes into the arts.
Language skills, learned a lot about the foundations of an opera, not much about film

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
strengths- very interesting content, reasonable workload with helpful feedback, amazing prof, small class size
weaknesses- sometimes it was confusing what our assignments were because they would be posted in multiple locations, but anna was always accommodating and reasonable with deadlines.

Weaknesses: None at all, honestly!
Strengths: This class was such a relaxing way to improve my Italian language skills, and Anna was such an amazing professor to learn under. There was always such interesting discussion with interesting perspectives on each of the operas that we studied, and it was awesome to actually take a field trip to the Metropolitan Opera as well. The reading responses that were due before each class (definitely not overwhelming) were a great way to stay engaged with what was going to be discussed in class without giving too much busy work.
I thought it was really great and structured well

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes! a very interesting Italian course with an amazing prof. the content is very unique and interesting, and the workload is also reasonable.

Yes! I would absolutely recommend this course to another student. I was so nervous coming into class on my first day, but I quickly realized how kind and welcoming Anna was to all of her students. The material in this course was incredibly interesting, and it was a great way to both learn more about Italian culture and develop Italian language skills. It's such a low-stakes, encouraging environment to learn in, and I think that Anna played a huge part in creating such an environment. The feedback on all of our written assignments was always so detailed, and Anna made sure to spend time correcting both grammar, idiomatic phrases, and general content. If you're looking for a nice way to work up to near-fluency, this class is great!

I would highly recommend this course to another student. Professor Iacovella makes improving Italian language skills a highly engaging experience through group discussions and activities. The course also does a fantastic job of showcasing some of the best works of Italian opera and fostering an appreciation of Italian opera.

extras.title: ITAL 157 01 - Italian through Opera and Film
